subject: Travel
title: The Himalayas and Sagarmatha
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Himalayas and Sagarmatha.

hook.text: Nepal's Sagarmatha National Park contains the top of the world â€” Mount Everest and four other peaks above 26,000 feet.

buildup.text: Sherpa communities have lived in the shadow of these peaks for centuries, guiding climbers and traders.

discovery.text: The park protects red pandas, snow leopards, and Himalayan black bears at extreme altitudes.

twist.text: Climbers leave behind tons of trash. Expeditions now must bring back all waste or lose their deposit.

climax.text: Sherpas organized cleanup missions, removing over 24,000 pounds of garbage from Everest since 2019.

punchline.text: The people who live there clean up after the people who visit.

quiz.question: What rule was introduced to reduce trash on Everest?
options: Expeditions must bring back all waste or lose their deposit
